# Pull Read

> Save articles from your bookmark services as clean, local markdown files.

Pull Read is an open-source macOS menu bar app and CLI tool that connects to bookmark services (Instapaper, Pinboard, Raindrop, Omnivore, Feedbin, and any RSS feed), extracts article content using Mozilla's Readability algorithm, and saves them as markdown files with YAML frontmatter.

## Key Features

- Bookmark service integration via RSS feeds
- Browser bookmark import (bookmarks.html)
- RSS/Atom auto-discovery from blog URLs
- Clean article extraction (Mozilla Readability)
- YouTube video support with full transcripts
- Podcast episode archival with audio links
- Markdown output with YAML frontmatter
- Built-in two-pane article reader (localhost:7777)
- Homepage dashboard with card-based landing page
- Explore view with tag cloud, source breakdown, and article connections
- Text highlighting in four colors (yellow, green, blue, pink)
- Inline annotations and article-level notes
- Article tagging and favorites
- Search operators: is:favorite, is:read, has:summary, tag:*, feed:*, domain:*, author:*, before:*, after:* with AND/OR logic
- Pinned filters: save up to 3 search queries as quick-access buttons
- AI-powered article summaries (Anthropic Claude, OpenAI GPT, Google Gemini, OpenRouter, Apple Intelligence)
- Summary provenance with provider/model badges saved to frontmatter
- AI-generated weekly reading reviews
- AI-powered auto-tagging of articles
- Text-to-speech with 4 providers: Browser (free), Kokoro local AI (free), OpenAI, ElevenLabs
- Voice notes via Web Speech API microphone recording
- Export articles as markdown with optional highlights, notes, summary, and tags
- Smart deduplication and retry for failed extractions
- Self-contained native macOS menu bar app (no dependencies)
- Cloud-sync friendly (Dropbox, iCloud, Google Drive, or any folder)
- Automatic updates with signed binaries

## Technical Details

- macOS app: Tauri 2 (Rust) with embedded web viewer
- CLI: TypeScript compiled to standalone binary via Bun
- Viewer: Single-file HTML/CSS/JavaScript served locally
- Distribution: Signed and notarized DMG via GitHub Releases
- Auto-updates: Tauri updater plugin with minisign signature verification
- Configuration stored at ~/.config/pullread/
- Articles saved as date-prefixed markdown files (e.g., 2026-02-10-article-title.md)
- TTS audio cached locally in .tts-cache/ directory
- Notes, highlights, and annotations stored in .notes/ directory

## Links

- Website: https://pullread.com
- Download: https://pullread.com/#download
- By: A Little Drive (https://alittledrive.com)
